techmeme.title: FTC v. Meta: in opening arguments, FTC lawyers accuse Meta of a "buy-or-bury strategy" to cement a social networking monopoly by buying Instagram and WhatsApp (New York Times)
Autonomous trucking startup Kodiak Robotics says it plans to go public in the US via blank-check company Ares Acquisition Corp II, valuing Kodiak at $2.5B (Deborah Sophia/Reuters)
Hugging Face acquires French startup Pollen Robotics, which makes the bug-eyed, two-armed, humanoid robot called Reachy 2, and plans to sell the robot (Will Knight/Wired)
Meta says it plans to train its AI models on public content, like posts and comments, and interactions that users have with its AI in the EU starting this week (Meta)
Nvidia starts making its Blackwell chips at TSMC's Phoenix plant and says it aims to make up to $500B of AI infrastructure in the US in the next four years (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
